text: Takashi Shimokawara (July 25, 1906 – March 11, 2011) was a Japanese centinarian from Kamaishi, Iwate. He is the current M100 world record holder in the shot put, discus and javelin throw. He also holds the M95 Japanese national record in the javelin, set at the age of 100.http://www.j-master.gr.jp/2010asiarecord.pdf He was killed during the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami at age 104.http://www.iaaf.org/aboutiaaf/news/newsid=59653.html Mr. Shimokawara would have a daily exercise routine that included a jog, press ups, squat thrusts and horizontal leg raises. He took up Masters athletics in 2004, at the age of 98.http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5331804.ece == References == Category:1907 births Category:2011 deaths Category:Deaths in earthquakes Category:Japanese centenarians Category:Japanese male discus throwers Category:Japanese male javelin throwers Category:Japanese male shot putters Category:Japanese masters athletes Category:Natural disaster deaths in Japan Category:Victims of the 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami Category:World record holders in masters athletics
